etymology.description: ⿰革(革) (gé, "leather") + 勹(勹) (bāo, "wrap") + 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") = earlier form of 鞠(鞠) (jū, "brew") -> derived from 麴(麴) (qū, "starter")
etymology.interpretation: The character 匊(jū, "rice in a house") is a phono-semantic compound clipped from 鞠(鞠), where the semantic 米(米) conveys the idea of rice, and phonetic components relate it to brewing and fermentation.
